description:
Used to live up the hill on Clay & Larkin over twenty years ago. Was walking in the neighborhood after a long absence and was delighted to see Hahn's still going strong!
The tiny hole-in-the-wall Chinese Restaurant next door was gone.
Hahn's has expanded and gone a little bit upscale, but not too much.
Try the Bi Bim Bop, sizzling...you won't be disappointed!
author: Alexander B.

description: I visit SF and have lunch here every time. The BBQ short rib/chicken combo is my go to meal. Have had the sizzling Bim Bop in the past and that is big and excellent flavors and value. Would highly recommend, but keep your order simple as servers are ESL and to avoid any issues I would suggest pointing at menu when ordering. This place has been open since 1982 for a reason as the food is excellent!
author: Todd W.

description: Really great stone grilled bibimbob! Tofu soup is my next favorite item. Because there's such a dearth of decent korean food in the City, it's a treat when I find some close to home cooking dishes.
author: Jeannie C.

description: Don't let the name hibachi turn you off, this place is pretty legit. They remain true to their roots and the food is tasty. I also live really close by the location plays a big factor for me. I don't like how yelp is forcing me to write more words so now I'm just writing words. I like this place though. Worth a try for sure. Not the best Korean food but it's legit.
author: Richard H.

description:
Very ignorant owner. I asked for grilled pork send witch with extra meat with table hot sauce, they put bbq sauce inside and couldn't eat the sandwich. I called back and explained the issue, owner made the Sandwitch himself and made sure to put table hot Sause inside, refused to give me a free sandwitch. They don't speak much English there as well which generates an issue when you want your sendwitch made the way you like.

Stay away from this location. Irving street is much better than Polk.

Some very bad people in Korean Hibachi world work here.
author: Erast B.

description:
First impression- friendly service and squeaky clean bathrooms. Yikes, Ali Wong would not approve. But given the location, the customers are mainly non-Asians looking for Korean BBQ where you can get for KBBQ fix without needing to dry clean your entire outfit immediately after the meal. Hence they need to cater to the nice people/clean bathroom kinda crowd, which I definitely don't mind myself! Must admit, my expectations were low considering this place is called "hibachi," which is a form of japanese (not korean) grilling that you can find in anywhere (unlike other forms of japanese grilling like yakitori, yakiniku, and binchotan). 

FOOD
The menu format is mostly bbq protein + rice + salad for a set price, but if you ask for banchan, they will bring you kimchi and lightly seasoned namul (probably a type of Korean). My friend got the pork bulgogi, which I found to be much too sweet and sauce-heavy but she liked it. 
I personally would not get kBBQ at a place that cooks it for you unless it comes on a hot sizzling stone plate. But if waiting in line at YakiniQ (Japantown) or traveling to the East Bay just to wait in line at any of the delicious "all you can eat" KBBQ spots in Oakland does not appeal to you, I'm sure Hahn's would be just fine. 

Rather than risk being underwhelmed by the bbq, I opted for the traditional menu and got the "sizzling" dolsot (stone bowl) bibimbap. I was chock full of fresh Korean veggies and gogi. The gojuchang (spicy red pepper paste) was excessively mild though. 

ALCOHOL
Soju prices are relatively low at $9.95 for a bottle of chamisul rich, and $9.50ish for a large glass bottle of Hite or Sapporo. 

Food gets 3.5 stars, but the lack of lines considering its location on Polk, cheap alcohol prices, far-too-clean bathrooms, and nice people make it a 4. I will most definitely come back because despite the underwhelming menu, it's easy to find seats for a group, the experience is comfortable for those unaccustomed to Korean food, and the alcohol is cheaper than other spots in SF.
author: Christine K.

description: For the price and quality of food this place is 5 Stars. Quick, fast and yummy Korean bbq. Friendly staff and clean restaurant. They also have wine and sake.
author: Tina L.

description: Wow it shocks me to see so many mixed reviews! The owners are SO friendly, the food is always consistently good and they carry Hite a great cheap Korean beer. We eat in or take out a few times a month here and it never disappoints! Also I am allergic to shrimp and they always accommodate by giving me and extra pot sticker in lieu of the shrimp tempura :)
author: Siobhain G.

description:
Bad customer service. Horrible food. The cashier or the owner (the guy with the glasses) has a bad attitude. I don't know if they do something to my soft tofu soup because it tasted funny. If I get sick the next day, I'm calling the health department! Never coming back here ever again.

Update: 
After drinking soft tofu soup, two hours later, I have diarrhea. They probably put something in my soup
Or the tofu wasn't fresh. Luckily I am fine, no food poison. Otherwise I'll definitely call the health department on them.
author: Sharon W.

description:
There aren't too many Korean options towards the east or north side of SF. When I have kalbi cravings, this place does the trick. But I do live 1 block away from the place, which helps and probably biases me a little :)

It's not cheap at around $20 for dinner. The meat is a little chewy and slightly fatter than normal. The spicy pork is pretty good too and the portions are solid. I've only ordered takeout here with no problems.
author: Young Y.

description: This place deserves more than 3.5 stars! Good value for money, good hours, quick service, neat place. Awesome sauce! We ordered the BBQ combo which i really recommend
author: Ashley O.

description: Food is just okay nothing to write home to mom about...not used to kimchi having a fishy taste to it (waiter took off the kimchi saying its a regional thing with that flavor which makes sense...tho I was stationed in S. Korea and had been all over the country and never had fishy kimchi). The service is amazing very attentive. Which brings the place into 4 stars instead of 3 but the food just being average doesn't bring into 5 star territory.
author: Justin M.

description: I've been here a couple times. The food is fine, nothing special, but you can usually get something cheap and filling. However, my experience tonight was HORRENDOUS. I've never written a yelp review for a restaurant before, but after the way the owner spoke to me tonight, I felt that I had to. I ordered the same thing I always do and for some reason it was $9 more expensive tonight. When I asked why, he went off on me and said that I was wrong. I kindly mentioned that he should warn customers of price changes and he didn't give a f***, just yelled some more. My friends and I were so shocked and uncomfortable with his behavior. Won't be back and certainly won't recommend this place. There's much better food on Polk where you won't be treated like trash.
author: Abby F.

description: I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here. I didn't get anything crazy, just lunch combo #1 that had bbq chicken, rice, pot stickers, and shrimp tempura. Just enough of everything to get a taste and still be full.
author: Run.It.Off V.

description:
Polk Street is FILLED with such a selection of places that you sometimes end up walking right past these little gems, Hahns Hibachi is a total gem!

My coworkers and I started off with the lettuce wraps. Super yummy, but small portion so if you are ordering for the table, order 2. 

They have a good selection of "lunch specials" but the combination 3 for sure caught my attention. It comes with sliced pork, tempura, pot stickers, a side of white rice, and a side salad. Everything was really good. The pork was thinly sliced, perfectly cooked, with a sweet glaze on top. Tempura, of course you can't go wrong with. They were fried to perfection and not greasy! I think the pot stickers were definitely the highlight! I've never had them fried before so YESSSSS order the pot stickers.

The service was meh! The older lady, possibly the server wasn't very friendly. She was straight to the point. We ordered drinks, ordered food, ate, paid, and left. There wasn't much "how is everything" or "do you need something". Eh, whatever, food was good though!
author: Sabrina J.

description:
If you want a quick, tasty, cheap meal in Lower Nob Hill, check out the only Korean joint in the neighborhood; Hahn's.

I came in here with my friend for a speedy meal before heading out for the evening.

It's a small location, with seating in the front and the kitchen in the back. You can sit at the window that faces Polk Street and quietly enjoy your meal.

We were the only patrons in there that evening and the owner took our order and got our plates out shortly there after.

We both ordered the BBQ Chicken with Rice, Sprout Salad, Cucumber Salad And Kimchee. The chicken was tender and the rice was nicely cooked and the two side salads added a crunch that balanced the dish.

It was a good portion of food, such that nothing needed to be taken home in a doggie bag. That's a good thing if this is your first stop : )
author: Diana V.

description:
Pretty standard Korean spot or rather pretty standard spot that serves somewhat Korean-flavored food.  Their lunch specials are pretty good for about $10 you can get two pieces of chicken, 2 fried mandoo, 2 shrimp tempura, rice, and a salad.  Not bad for Polk Street.  I'm not a fan of the BBQ chicken sauce - it tastes kind of like bad cheap teriyaki sauce.  But the spicy chicken is pretty good.  And strangely I like the fried mandoo!

I've seen other people order the dolsot bi bim bap (hot stone bi bim bap) and it looked pretty good. Never tried it but might consider it again.

No ban chans provided.

No grill tables (if you want to grill, this is not your BBQ joint, even though the name sounds like you could)

So it feels more like just an American restaurant that serves Korean flavored food.

Single sex single bathroom in the back.
author: Traci H.

description: Headed down to the Bay Area to see a comedy show my buddy wanted to try Hibachi because he had never tried it before. This was a very difficult type of food to find in SF. Unfortunately this place wasn't the type of Hibachi I am used to. We got to this restaurant and they don't cook your food in front of you which was disappointing. We decided to stay and eat. The waiter/owner took over 20 minutes to take our drink order. We had been there for awhile so we just ordered our food at the same time. We both ordered the spicy beef plate. The plate had fried tempura shrimp and tempura vegetables and a salad. We also ordered a side of potstickers. The beef plate was all around pretty good. We never actually received our potstickers and our waiter wasn't around much so we just decided to forget about them. I feel bad for my buddy so I will have to take him for some real Hibachi back home. I won't be coming here again.
author: Thomas R.

description:
Better-half loves it... She finally drags me in and she explains my reluctance on not finding a "korean" restaurant as good as the ones in San Jose! 

Owner or Manager insists that He WILL change my perspective! 

NOT! Spicy Challenge was NO even close. 

FAIL! Korean for pansies
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: We found something in our water, looked like a small wad of paper kind of gross so they replaced it for us. We got the wrap and the combo platter #3 with pot stickers. Meh. We've had better wraps elsewhere but the whole meal filled us up and it wasn't that bad.
author: Gina B.

description: Super tasty! Food came out quick. Service was nice but wasn't consistent on checking on us. Only came to give the bill and to grab the empty plates, but that's ok cause the food was awesome! Give this cute little place a try.
author: Jeannette C.

description: I come pretty often for the #1 lunch combo. I​ would love to try something different but I am satisfied with this order so I never venture out. Oh well maybe next time.​
author: LaVonda S.

description:
Our go-to for quick and delicious! 

Try the sizzling Bi Bom Bop, it's amazing and a standard at every meal. Nice family run place.
author: Lacey J.

description: Unlike any other Korean BBQ I had. Utterly lacking in flavor compared to any other Korean BBQ. Literally just barbecued meat with a bit of sauce added at the end.
author: James Q.

description: We ate here for lunch and I was a good choice.  Their lunch menu was reasonable.  I ordered the lunch combo #1.  BBQ chicken with two tempura shrimp and chicken jun.  it also comes with side salad and rice.  It was good and enough food to get you through the day.  Next time I'm here I will try their other BBQ in their menu.
author: Mark R.

description: Nice good lunch specials. For a bay area budget of $12 you'll get full on any of the meaty combinations.
author: Jamie O.

description:
May be Hahn's itself set the bar too high when they wrote "Unquestionably the Ultimate in Korean BBQ."
.
Americanized as this is, it isnt the Ultimate Korean anything. That is to say, no Ban Chan comes with any order. I had a Chicken Sandwich that came on a soft roll with moist marinated and grilled chicken covered in cheese. The sandwich had no lettuce, tomato or anything else but it still hit the spot. If it had not come with a side salad it would have been just to heavy all by itself.
.
The restaurant was very clean and the one server very attentive. Im kinda on the fence about going back as there are so many other "real" Korean restaurants available in San Francisco.
author: Caesar A.

description:
Love Hahn's. Cheap, fast, lots of food, high quality. I always get the spicy chicken and pork combo - highly recommend. Also, last time I went, I realized they have a liquor license. Great for (cheap) sake bombs, however it's a relatively small restaurant and not the type of environment to get rowdy. I wish they were open on Sundays!

Overall, underrated spot with great cheap food. I generally go at least once or twice per month.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Marin, for a long time had a Hahn's Hibachi.  I never went there and then they closed and I regretted that.  It seemed the least I could do was support the only Korean joint in the county given how frequently I bemoan the lack of ethnic eats here.  Live and learn.

San Francisco doesn't have a lack of Korean joints but they do still have Hahn's and that right there seems sort of amazing.  I'm surprised that folks would go here over someplace more authentic but convenience might be a factor.  It was for me.  

After a single visit I can report that Hahn's will fill you up without killing your wallet but the experience will feel most akin to fast food Korean both in ambiance and taste.  There was nothing wrong with my Sizzling Beef Bebimbop (sic, $11.95) but it also fell short of the more flavorful, authentic version I've had at, say, Manna (on Irving).  A Korean Beer accompaniment ($3.50) helped take me out of fast food territory but not by much.  

I chuckled a bit reading some reviews which mention that Hahn's is not a good place for a date.  One yelper described it as "starkly unromantic" which is spot-on.  It also left me thinking "plastic",  perhaps owing to the furnishings.  So yeah, not a date place.  Don't even think about it.    

Hahn's fare brings to mind another chain Korean place, Sorabol, which is often found in food courts.  If the two were side-by-side I'd choose Sorabol over Hahn's every time but if this was my only option?  Well, it was my only option in Marin for quite a while and while it likely would've satisfied my Korean cravings I doubt it would've kept me out of SF, searching for flavors a bit more authentic.

And:
*  A "Health Score" of 71/100 is teetering a little too close to D+ range for my tastes.
author: Tracey A.

description:
Great little place on Polk Street. 
Start with the stuffed jalapeños. The soft tofu soup has a generous amount of tofu for tofu lovers.
Tender and flavorful pork bulgogi.
author: Abi H.

description: I've been coming here off and on for over thirty years, and the food and service were always excellent.  On the last visit, I ordered the same combo plate that I usually order, and the meal was not up to usual standards.  The meat was overcooked, the vegetables were greasy and bland, and even the sauce didn't taste right.  Maybe they were training a new cook.  I guess I'll stay away for 6-12 months and hope things will be better when I return.
author: Dean L.

description:
this is the only korean restaurant in nob hill so my boyfriend and i decided to come here for dinner. from the looks of the interior and the menu, you can tell that this is an americanized korean restaurant. we ordered japchae, chicken bibimbap in a hot stone pot, & pork bibimbap in a hot stone pot. 

japchae (korean clear noodles) (4/5): the noodles were pretty good. it came with broccoli, carrots, & mushrooms.

pork bibimbap (4/5): it's a little tasteless without the spicy sauce, so i recommend adding it to your dish. overall, the bibimbap was pretty good.

notes: this isn't a traditional restaurant, so don't expect side dishes. there are some japanese foods here like udon and tempura. the prices are similar to other korean restaurants. our waiter was attentive to refilling our water cups. i wish there were more traditional korean restaurants in nob hill because i really like eating the korean side dishes.
author: Sylvia H.

description:
We went on 3/10 and 3/11 , yes back to back. The first day we tried the BBQ ribs (standard portions) and BBQ beef , loved it and wanted to try more. On the second day I ordered the Meat Mountain and the misses got the chicken beef and shrimp kabobs.
We LOVED it. Tender meat, full of flavor, the juices not too strong or salty and tastes great when you blend the juice with rice. Portions are perfect for a hungry man like me. Any food that doesnt give my heartburn or indigestion is always a plus. 
Im gettng hungry just thinking about how good the food is there. 
Atmosphere was pleasant although on the second visit a police officer was yacking off on his cell phone a little too loud. No idea why people need to speak loudly on their cell phones in public ("hey listen to me world !" )  but anyway, the place is clean, the bathroom is sanitary.
Id call this one a winner ! :)
author: David S.

description:
The place itself is small and looked pretty abandoned, but the food was great. We took the bibimbap and the sauté chicken. They were both delicious and were served with great sauces. The food came quickly. 
Had a nice meal, but I don't think I'll go back there.
author: Dror M.

description: Good bi bim bop (traditional Korean dish with lots of veggies and a fried egg on top).  I get the beef (and order extra beef) and its a full meal fir pretty cheap - about 20 bucks.
author: Kevin M.

description: I ordered based off of the menu online and it says it's 14.95 yet I get there and it's $25.66. I asked why it's different he was super rude and just said "oh it's old." I said well you need to update it because that's not what I ordered and you didn't tell me the new price over the phone when I ordered either. He said oh well my boss will do it later. I said that's not my problem now here's $20 and I'll do he rest on card. He said it's okay just give me $25 I'll take the .66 off for you. Ummmm what??? You guys add $10 to my order then only take .66 off? Will not be back here.
author: Navya B.

description:
Bad service.  They forgot our order and serve customers who were after us.  If we didn't ask, they would have made us wait forever.  

Food is mediocre.
author: Steven P.

description: Phenomenal food and wonderful wait staff! Meal portions are generously large! Prices extremely reasonable! Great beer selection as well!
author: David G.

description:
Pretty decent korean food. I ordered the tofu stew, which was steaming hot. Note that even though they have 3 levels of spicy (mild, medium, hot), medium is not spicy at all, so if you are looking for some spice ask for the highest level.

The price is ok for the location.
author: Henry L.

description: A thin hair in the Lettuce. Otherwise the food quality is about 3.5 star： americanized food is not too expensive, and sort of thing you'd expect. But if ordering the authentic Korean, then it would be quite pricy and not so authentic/ tasty. Overall, their special menu is what I'd suggest to get.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I haven't been to this place in years and it continues to be a very satisfying meal.  Service was great and food is very tasty.  I would highly recommend.
author: Anna T.

description: I was quite satisfied with my vegetarian bibimbap that I came back the next day for another one. I'll be back.
author: Joshua P.

description: Spicy pork ribs combo plate is amazing. Great spice and flavor for the pork. Also, the pot stickers and tempura is very good.
author: Clayton P.

description:
The server wasn't the most sociable guy but he was cute and his service was quick and to the point. My water was never empty, I didn't wait or wave my arms like crazy to get him to come over and help. 

the LUNCH that I had here was amazing. The beef was a tad too flavorful but that's nothing a little H2O can't fix and besides, it was SOOO GOOD. The portion was great, the lunch combo came with rice, kimchi, fermented bean sprouts (i personally hate em), shrimp tempura, fried pot stickers and meat of your choice. Everything was so good and I was so fullllll. Can't you tell that makes me a happy girl?
author: Katherine L.

description: This is a very no frills Korean BBQ place. The portions are large and the prices are very reasonable. I had the spicy pork dinner special and it was super tasty! Definitely seems like a great place to grab take out from.
author: Jason S.

description: Started out with stuffed mushrooms, really good and the waiter was nice enough to warn us they are hot. Don't know what dipping sauce is but delicious combination. I had beef saute and boyfriend had chicken. Salad served with the meal super yummy!  LMine was supposed to be spicy, sure glad I didn't order the mild. Spicy in a nice easy way, very tasty. Vegetables are nice and crunchy and the sauce is delicious. Beef is nicely tender. Definitely would come back. The waiter was super pleasant and affable. A very good dinner!
author: Kelly P.

description:
3.5 Stars

Came here for lunch and were seated right away. We came around 1, which was great because the 12:00 crowd was just finishing up.
After we placed our orders, I felt like the food came out within minutes. (Could be a good or bad thing, right?)

I ordered lunch special combination that had (brown) rice, salad, 2 pieces of tempura shrimp, BBQ pork and chicken jun, which reminded me of chicken fried steak. The sauce that it was slathered in was too salty for my tastes.  But, the pork was very tasty and good. Next time, I'll make mine spicy tho. 

You definitely get a lot of food for the price. I'll be sure to come back again!
author: Mimie L.

description: NO PANCH'AN?!?!!  And the rest is history. THis is where I miss Santa Clara Korean  tofu /bbq places. They know what's up. Here....idk...food / dishes are okay. Nothing too special. Perhaps they're popular because they're the only Korean place  on Polk St? I could be wrong...it was okay, nothing to hype about.
author: mali b.

description: This is a great value spot with delicious spicy bbq chicken.  Get kimchi on the side.  Only $10 for their lunch special which comes with 2 potstickers as well as 2 shrimp tempura and a side salad.
author: Jay H.

description:
Not authentic Korean at all.  This place is to Korean food as Taco Bell is to Mexican food.

This did not satisfy my craving for Korean food at all.  Reasons to dislike this place:
-- Total lack of ban chan (the small dishes of food that come before/with the main meal)
-- Total lack of Korean flavors.  I really don't know what they were trying to do.
-- Tofu soup (sundubu) was not spicy at all. The soup was heavy in garlic flavor, which I enjoyed, but that was pretty much it.
-- Japchae (chewy noodles) appetizer was mostly flavored with soy sauce. That's so not right. It should be not so heavily sauced, and predominately flavored with sesame oil. The lightly steamed broccoli and random bits of vegetables sitting on top of it also felt out of place.
-- The kebab combo entree was a decent deal for price, but once again, the flavors weren't really Korean. (The shrimps were also super tiny! But I guess you do get what you pay for.)

The only redeeming thing would be the service. Fast water refills!
author: Jeanne L.

description:
If you're looking for Americanized Korean food then this is the place for you! Zero side dishes as their menu is filled with generic Asian food like salmon teriyaki, BBQ chicken/pork, short ribs, potstickers--you get the idea. Food wasn't that great either as everything was smothered in sauce. The salmon was a bit dry and their noodle soup broth was so salty I downed at least three cups of water to compensate! Service was ok, the waiter was attentive and refilled waters without us asking. 

The restaurant itself gives off a very casual vibe and is a bit dated--definitely a good hangout spot with friends (since they serve soju!) but not for a date. 

Unfortunately, I won't be coming back here again, their food is overpriced and not all that great.
author: Steph M.

description: Very good sizzling bi bim bop! Husband thought it was better than Mannas even though you don't get all the little pickled items to start. They did refill on the free Kim chee! We also had the spicy bbq short rib plate which came with a generous portion of meat that was not fatty and super easy to cut off the bone (before I sucked them dry). Be sure to get the sizzling bi bim bop in the hot stone bowl if you want your meal hot their other version is cold bi bim bop, not served warmed without the sizzling bowl like some other places. Two meals plus tax and tip $32.
author: B S.

description:
After checking the menu many times over the past months, we finally decided to jump in and grab lunch here. My partner had been here before but we always kind of balked at going in since their vegetarian options were sparse. There's a few tofu dishes though so in the interest of trying something new (at least for me), we took the gamble.

I ordered the tofu veggie kebabs, which came with rice and salad, while my partner ordered the chicken bbq (which came with the same sides). 

The kebabs came with several different veggies plus a single mushroom per skewer and a few chunks of tofu as well. The char flavour was definitely there and quite delicious. I wasn't a huge fan of the sauce, I think a different kind might've been better but that's my personal tastes.

I'd definitely like to try the bbq tofu next time around.
author: Cassandra J.

description: Came here before a night of drinking on Polk. The grilled bbq pork wasn't very good. There wasn't any taste of garlic, green onion, soy, or spice. Everything taste like it  was smothered in gochujang and ssamjang - super sweet, mild chili flavor, and with sesame.  Nothing tastes like authentic Korean food. I truly miss KBBQ back in LA.
author: Josh S.

description: The sizzling pork bibimbap is amazing. So full of flavor and came out quick to the table.
author: Chelsea O.

description:
I just liked this place.  Consistently good experience, friendly service.  For food alone, probably three stars, but I bump em up one because I liked them a lot.

I came in here when one of my hands was wrapped up after surgery and they asked me if I'd like my food cut up in the kitchen.  Why, yes i would, thank you very much.
author: Steve S.

description: 1st time in SF.  This place was recommend by my bartender at Cabin.  It definitely hit the Spot!!!  The food was delish and beer cold!
author: Ro S.

description:
WORST CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE IN MY LIFE.  Please take this review into consideration next time you contemplate giving Hahn's Hibachi your business.

I've been to Hahn's Hibachi many times before without incident - but after yesterday's (05/03/14, ~5PM) experience, this business will NEVER earn another $1 of my hard earned money.  Here is what happened...(if you want the abridged version of this review, read the part below the line)

My friend and I were hungry so we both agreed to place a pick-up order over the phone.  My friend wanted the bibimbap, one of his favorites, so I placed the order for him.  This is the conversation that ensued over the phone with the gentlemen at Hahn's Hibachi:

Me: "Hello, can I please place an order for pickup?"
Hahn's Hibachi Employee (HHE): "Yes, what would you like?"
Me: "Can I please get the steak bibimbap?"
HHE: In a very annoyed/rude voice - "WE DON'T HAVE STEAK, WE ONLY HAVE BEEF"
Me: "Ok, so we can't get steak instead of beef?"
HHE: Continues to be extremely disrespectful "SIR, LIKE I TOLD YOU, WE DON'T HAVE STEAK, ONLY BEEF"

At this point I was completely blown away with how rude and unprofessional this gentlemen was being over the phone.  I didn't say another word, hoping he would come to his senses, relax, and hopefully apologize.  Unfortunately, he didn't...
___________________________________________________________________
(Context: Placing a bibimbap order over the phone, employee being extremely rude saying that they don't have steak, only beef)

Here is what happened next, and the reason why I will NEVER go back to Hahn's Hibachi:

Me: "I would appreciate some better customer service, I don't understand why you're being so rude"
Hahn's Hibachi Employee (HHE): "I TOLD YOU, WE DON'T HAVE STEAK, WE HAVE ONLY BEEF"
ME:  "You know what, I don't think I want to place an order anymore"
HHE: "FINE I DON'T WANT TO TAKE YOUR ORDER ANYWAYS, FUCK-OFF"

The employee literally told me to FUCK OFF...are you kidding me?  I understand people have bad days, but this is absolutely NO WAY TO TREAT YOUR CUSTOMERS.  

I'm disgusted, angry, and distraught.  No one deserves to be treated like this, especially a customer.  Oh - and if you're reading this HHE, this is also going on my FB so not only did you lose my business, but at least 1,158 others.  I hope you learn from this.
author: Jeffrey O.

description: If you want a place that you can sit down with no wait, get amazing service and consistently bomb-ass food, then come to this place. They must not buy advertising from Yelp and so that's why they only have 3.5 stars overall. My boyfriend and I eat here at least once a week because we know exactly what we will get every time: fast/good service and good food.
author: Sarah K.

description:
It is not like the meat here is the best meat you have ever eaten, but where else can you get the T-Rex of carnage called the Meat Mountain Plate consisting of BBQ beef, BBQ ribs, pork chops, BBQ chicken, etc. for under $20 in this city?  Only right here!  Every time I order this though, there is always someone staring down at me, as if a petite gal like me cannot possibly be a meat crazie.  Awww yeah...I am just like that Adam Richman guy from Man vs. Food, but with better metabolism.

1 star off: What, no all-you-can-eat option?
author: Ally W.

description:
It took Jamie W. and me forever to try Hahn's Hibachi on Polk because Jamie - OK, we - are obsessed with Miller's East Coast Deli across the street. Between the matzoh ball soup and the beef brisket on challah, we always made a beeline when we were strolling around Nob Hill, but on Christmas Eve, we had a recurrence of shpilkes in our genecktageesoinks since they were closed. You coulda knocked us over with a paper towel, single ply. 

Well, begrudgingly with our heads lowered to the sidewalk, we tried Hahn's, and it turned out to be like a pistil in my scheinel ponnum. We both had the same thing, the $10.50 "Beboppin' Bi-bim-bop" served in a cast iron pot just like we were on an episode of M*A*S*H in a rice patty (see photo). It was chock full of deliciousness with chunks of barbecue pork and a whole lot of vegetables with a sunny-side egg in the mix. It's all on top of a mound of crackling rice that gets all brown and crunchy since that pot is frickin' hot to the touch. 

We were both blowing our pots for about five minutes before we could dive in. Jamie, however, had the foresight to order the $5.95 Steak-Stuffed Jalapenos, all tempura-fried and yet still crunchy despite the oil drenching (see photo). They were good in that bulimic crack-pipe sort of way. It's comfort food on a cold holiday evening and may be worth passing up some pastrami for...if Miller's is closed, for sure anyway. 

FOOD - 4 stars...old-school bi-bim-bop done to cracking satisfaction 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...clean, just a bit sterile 
SERVICE - 4 stars...very courteous and responsive 
TOTAL - 4 stars...Korean food on the fly...good stuff
author: Ed U.

description:
Hahn's is probably not the best place to take a date. It's a bit dingy, cramped, and starkly unromantic. If you would rather stuff your face with a plate of BBQ'ed meat than deal with awkward small-talk though, Hahn's your man.

Don't forget to ask for a small side of Kimchi!
author: Aaron J.

description:
Been coming to this Hahn's when it was the only Hahn's and the owner worked it.

Their food is still good and tasty but during the last few visits we noticed that while prices have gone up portions have gone down.  The meats and chicken are sliced even thinner too.  I don't like that you also have to pay for kim-chee as a side, huh?why?  Originally they used to give it for free as part of your plate with the salad and bean sprouts.

Never had a problem with service whether eating there or "to-go".  FYI, they just started being closed on Sunday boo!
author: J D.

description: The taste of the spicy beef was great but for 11.50 I would like a little more than chop meat, white rice, lettuce and old ass coagulated dressing. Eh.
author: Brittney D.

description:
It's more like 3.5 stars but I rounded up because the waitress had to put up with some crap from a homeless guy yelling in her face, but she kept her composure and still apologized to some of the eat-in diners for having to see something that was entirely not of her fault.

So even though I swore this place off some two and a half years ago I found myself back there last night after attending the Lumpia Cook-Off at the Space Gallery.  Some people can live off of delicious lumpia and bottled beer, but I felt the need to soak up some of my alcohol intake with something more filling.  I wanted rice, but the first place I thought of was super crowded.  Hahn's was busy too, but at least there was seating available.  The only waitress there had me take a seat and peruse the menu while she cleared off a small table just for me.

The menu appears much larger than I remembered.  They've added quite a few menu items.  I wanted rice though plus some meat.  Oh decisions, decisions.  I'd never tried their kabobs so I went with the Chicken, Beef and Shrimp Kabob Combo which is served with steamed rice, a green salad and bean sprout salad.  Considering how busy the kitchen was I was surprised that the wait for my food wasn't too long.

Six skewers were featured on the long oval platter, two with teriyaki chicken thighs, two with four small shrimp on each, one with marinated flank steak and a veggie one with grilled mushroom, carrot, zucchini, broccoli and onion.  Although the shrimp was slightly overcooked I enjoyed all of the skewers.  The portion of steamed rice was perfect for my appetite and while I'm not a big fan of bean sprout salad I find myself eating it often because I love the flavor of sesame seed oil.

I felt so good after the big meal that I went back to work and cleared all my paper work so I could start out fresh the next day.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
The food was really good but the portions were a little bit smaller than I'm used to. The rib combination comes with three different ribs, one of which had very little meat. No free rice or side dishes such as kimchi which most korean alternatives offer. The tofu soup came with peeled shrimp which makes me happy. The spicy pork bulgogi is very spicy and sweet at the same time.

Overall, I like the food, just provide more generous portions for the price. The place is definitely not the ultimate korean bbq restaurant and I'm tempted to give it 4 stars for claiming to be.
author: Kevin A.

description:
Delicious! I recommend the beef BBQ.... Totally yakuniku and very delicious. Staff was very courteous and prices were reasonable. Not too crowded when we went on a Sunday night. 
We chose this restaurant because as we were looking at it another woman walked up to get take out and told us it was so good that this was her 2nd night coming there. Her word was good.
author: Ginger M.

description:
My wife and I stopped here because it was in the way to our destination and I am so happy that we did.

We both had the lunch combos: she chose the #1 and I the #2, chicken and beef, respectively. Both were delicious and had a nice variety of foods including tempura shrimp, salad, rice, and a choice of a side. I recommend going for the spicy version of the combo--it had the perfect kick.

The service was fast and the restaurant was clean. What a great food find considering we weren't looking very hard.
author: Kevin H.

description:
- Service was great! Our waiter always had a smile on his face and was so genuine. 
- Stuffed mushrooms were delicious (thanks yelpers!)
- Tofu soup had a yummy broth and I felt that this was much better than other places I've had.
- Prices were reasonable and affordable!
author: Emily C.

description:
Eat here all the time!

I loved this place, their potstickers are insanely delicious.
My husband ordered something called the meat mountain and it was a mountain alright!
We're going back for dinner again tonight, cause seriously, this place is fast, clean, attentive and the food is amazing.
author: Ella A.

description:
This is a good neighborhood place for Korean food. It's not outstanding, given that Korean food isn't really prevelant in SF except for in the Richmond and Sunset neighborhoods, but it will satisfy your K-cravings. The decor is sparse. Seating can be tight from 8pm on so I'd suggest getting there for lunch or an earlier dinner. 

When there, get the tofu soup (sundubu)! The bulgogi is meh which is unfortunate. If you want korean bbq, I wouldn't come to Hahn's. Hahn's seems to be better at Korean comfort food like soups and stews.
author: Nene K.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in SF. It has a very casual atmosphere (which I like), and the food is amazing. Any time someone visits me from out of town, I bring them here and literally every single person has raved about it.

The consensus among my friends is that the sizzling bibimbop is the best dish. I also strongly recommend the potstickers.
author: Tyler K.

description: I'm always on the lookout for good Korean food and it's great to have found a place in my neighborhood! Pretty good prices considering the portions and service was super quick on a Sunday for dinner. Between the 5 of us, we ordered the veggie sizzling bibimbop, soft tofu soup with seafood, chicken jun, pile o'beef, and BBQ pork and we had tons of leftovers. The bibimbop was perfect with the cripsy rice edges and the soft tofu soup was good at medium but if you like a little more heat don't be afraid to step it up to spicy. The BBQ pork was delicious - perfectly sweet and savory. Overall, awesome meal! Would have liked a selection of banchan like typical Korean restaurants but it's not a make or break.
author: Tiffany F.

description:
These guys have awesome bbq sandwiches, my favorite is pork sandwich with hot sauce and grilled onions, try their stuffed peppers and you'll be crying from happiness.

Great location and service.
author: Andy N.

description:
This is a really awesome vegetarian takeout option for people around Polk and Pac Heights.
They have an awesome rice and tofu dish that they are able to make pretty quickly, which I seem to manage to eat up even quicker (because its so good!)
Must nom here more often!
author: Aditya M.

description: Decent Korean BBQ place on Polk Street. We went for a late meal and were the 1 of 2 groups in the restaurant, but received really slow service which was a little annoying. When we finally were ready to order, I got the bibimbap with bulgogi and my girlfriend got the spicy pork. My bibimbap came in a hot stone bowl and was really good, but my girlfriends dish was overly oily and was not what we expected. Maybe this poor review is due to our expectations, but many Korean meals come with numerous side dishes which we did not get as this restaurant. The 'salad' that we also got was literally like lettuce and balsamic vinegar..While this place satisfied my bibimbap cravings, the value really wasn't there and I think there are much better options out there.
author: Jimmy C.

description:
If it weren't for the Yelp mobile app guiding me, I would have passed this spot liked the muggles passing by the Leaky Cauldron.

Delicious Korean food awaits the astute explorer (or cheaters using the Yelp mobile app) and she won't have to be bothered with any wait for a table. The prices are very reasonable and with generous portions, how can I not be tempted to come back?
author: Jason C.

description:
We ordered the Mega Deluxe and the Sizzling Bi Bim Bop and they were both great! We will definitely go back again. The meat was flavorful and juicy and the gochujang was tasty. 

I lived in Korea for over a year and I get nostalgic when eating the food. So my only wish about this place is about the conversation I had with the waiter-- there wasn't one. Upon ordering, I told him that I lived in S. Korea and miss the food and I was hoping for a little interest on his part about my experience. His response was pretty anticlimactic and monosyllabic, although a really nice waiter. Otherwise, I'm a huge fan!
author: Roya D.

description:
Decent Korean BBQ.

I'm not sure about non-BBQ menus and I do not care because the restaurant's name has BBQ in it. Try the BBQ menus.

I usually have the dinner combo, which is around $11. BBQ and rice are all good but I wish they had more veges and less fried stuff. 

The flavor is good but when you are about the finish the dish, you'll start to feel that it's kinda greasy. Bunch of fried veges and a pot sticker comes with the dish. But like I said, BBQ is good.

Price is a-ok. Could be cheaper but hey, it's San Fran. Less than 15 buck then I don't care much.

Tip? Get the Spicy Pork BBQ and you won't regret it.
author: Brandon K.

description: After a long hike, the Mountain of Meat was great and plentiful. Good Kimchi. Friendly waiter.
author: Ray W.

description: Consistently good food, ample portions at a very affordable price. It's also very clean with a helpful staff. One of my favorite places. Great bang for the buck.  The BBQ Chicken is one of my favs.  You can't go wrong with the beef ribs, 3 nice sized ribs hot from the grill.
author: Doug W.

description: This is my favorite go to spot whenever I crave meat and Korean food. I really like all of their meat dishes and my favorite is the pork chop. I love their spicy BBQ sauce and I always get it on the side. Their salad dressing is the bomb, its more like meat dressing, it tastes so good on any bbq and even rice.
author: isaac l.

description:
Hahn's Korean BBQ: Where to begin?

Well, this place is average. All this hype on how good this place!,ends here. 

Positive: 
Barbeque Chicken Sandwich is really good, The price is affordable.

Negative:
They burn there meat way too dark. There BBQ beef is too tough, that it is a struggle to chew it.

One of the most popular restaurant on that block.
author: Matt G.

description:
My bf and I moved into the neighborhood a few months ago and have been putting this restaurant off because c'mon, 3.5 stars? Ain't nobody got time for that.

Finally one day when I was craving Korean and didn't want to go too far, we decided to come here and thank god because this place is AMAZING! I've gone back at least once a week since then. 

I usually get the sizzling bibimbap with spicy bbq chicken and my bf gets the combo #1 or #3. The food is amazing every single time. I really think the sizzling bibimbap is the best item on their menu!

As for customer service, I've also only had good experiences so I'm surprised by the some of the comments on Yelp! The waiters there have always been accommodating if I was something subbed out/in or cooked a certain way.

All in all, if you want quick, delicious food, go here!
author: Roopa A.

description: Absolutely LOVE this place! I have been eating here pretty religiously for the past couple of years and made this my place for when I'm wanting a "special" meal. The atmosphere is pleasant and the seating is comfy. It can be a little loud upon RARE occasion as this is a family restaurant but, for the most part it's fairly quiet. It's really clean and you can tell the waiter takes great pride in his job - tables are cleaned immediately after a customer departs, the floors are clean, he's friendly, he's prompt to take your order and checks on you afterwards without being annoying (not to mention the appetizers come out before your meal and the meal comes when your appetizer is finished - I LOVE THAT and that is how it SHOULD be done). The food is incredible! I almost ALWAYS get the Pile Of Beef which comes with a GIANT rib with an awesome amount of meat on it, a skewer of tender beef that has been ribboned on it from top to bottom, sliced beef and 1 - 2 thin cut (small bone in) steaks and comes with a side of sticky rice (perfectly cooked - not to sticky and not to loose) and a little dash of salad with a sweet dressing......... DELICIOUS! It's a lot of food and I usually have to take half of it home with me and relish in delight that I have more for lunch. Dinner normally costs around $40 - $50 for two people including tip (I also get the tempura appetizer and 2 sodas). All entrees are VERY healthy portions so, if you like meat (and lots of it) at a reasonable, non-tourist price then I suggest going here. They have a great selection to chose from without it being overwhelming, friendly and prompt waiter, food is served quickly, it's all delicious, easy to get to and an incredible price - THEN GO HERE!
author: Jamilah A.

description:
I was pretty surprised to see such low reviews for this place.

Husband and I were wandering around Polk street around 9pm Friday night looking for a place to eat that was still open. Stumbled upon this gem. The host/waiter was really attentive and seated very quickly. I watched him go around the room checking on every table. He truly cared about the customers in the restaurant which is a HUGE plus to me. I'm so use to getting servers who really don't care about what they do. I chose the Chap Jae noodles with chicken. Husband chose dinner combo #2 with ribs, potstickers and tempura. We were both amazed at just how tasty and delicious the bbq meat tasted. Definitely one of the best places I've eaten BBQ meat at. Jap Chae was served with some gravy-not traditional but still yummy. We were so happy that we decided to go there and make it our spot every Friday night.
author: Jessica F.

description:
A great low-key neighborhood spot.  Roll in in a 'hoddy and jeans with the ball and chain in tow and experience simple flavorful dishes. I opted for the BBQ chicken Bibimbop - a great combo(also offered with either barbecued pork, or beef) mixed with crunchy stir-fried vegetables and a fried egg and crispy rice on the bottom. 
Mr. V was very happy with his 'Pile of meat' a dish with beef or pork 3 ways.
Will definitely return. . .
author: Kia B.

description:
A few years ago we decided to come to Hahn's Hibachi for lunch. The waitress was incredibly rude, unfriendly, and impatient. Considering that Hahn's gives out a lot of food, we told the waitress we were going to share a plate. She said it wasn't allowed and had to have a bill more than $10 to eat in the restaurant. We stood up and left. The waitress seemed annoyed but we were more annoyed with her attitude, so we never returned. 

If you're going to have own a restaurant, hiring friendly staff goes a very long way.
author: K. E.

description: Friendly and helpful staff, awesome food.  The sizzling bi bim bop was exactly what I wanted... Hot rice with sesame oil crisping at the bottom of the pot delicious veggies, meat and egg on top... What more could you want?
author: Andrew V.

description: An incredibly tasty and well-priced place, the best I've had in a while. Would not hesitate recommending.
author: Jack S.

description:
just ate the Meat Mountain entree for $14.95.  Tender porkchop, korean short rib, ribs, chicken and some other meat, so much meat.  The chop and short ribs were good, but the ribs were a little tough.  It also came with rice, cabbage salad and some cooked bean sprouts.  Pretty good deal, there's other meat plate options, but you can also get bulgogi, udon noodles or bimbimbop here.  So in other words, there's a great selection here.  It's not the BEST Korean food by any means, its not even that authentic, but its more of a bbq twist.

There's a good amount of seating, and there's even a little bar area facing the window if that's your thing.  The waitress was attentive and nice.

I think I'll just order their short ribs only next time or try the sizzling bimbimbop.  But this place warrants another visit, I would give it 3.5 stars.
author: Kevin W.

description: The truth of the matter is I have had better Korean food in the middle of Indiana. My bibimbap was only ok. We tried the tempura calamari and it was overcooked. My bf's spicy bulgogi was very good though. They were also very fast with takeout.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Everytime we visit S.F.,we make it a point to come here for dinner. It's not the greatest Korean BBQ but it's very good and convenient for the money. The service is good, place is clean, and the food is so tasty. The bill is under $90 for family of 4. That includes drinks and tip.
author: Paul L.

description:
Aw, Hahn's.. 3.5 for me, I'm holding out on that 4th star cos I know you can do better!

- Solid good food with no frills
- Okay, simple service
- Decor is a bit dated and generic
- Portions are generous

Meat is always well cooked, and unlike some other reviewers, I never feel
like it's overly fatty/greasy. i think if the atmosphere was a bit warmer, and
the staff was a tiny bit friendlier, it would improve the overall experience 
and bring me back more often... cos I can always use some good ol' tofu soup
and pork chops when it's cold out!
author: Jade T.

description:
On Friday I was craving a plate lunch that I can get from back home in Hawaii. So I searched for the closest korean bbq place I could find near my apt and found Hahn's Hibachi. I'm glad I went here. It hit the spot! I had a spicy kalbi plate with rice, tempura and kimchi. I was basically inhaling the food. If you eat a lot of rice I'd suggest getting a side of rice cause that's what I had to do.

Our server was really nice as well. Hard worker and very nice. 

The street view of this place does not give the food justice at all! Very good food for pretty cheap price. A must go!
author: Marisa B.

description: Got take out here over the weekend. Was craving galbi and korean bbq. Everything is delish and it took about 15 min for my order. It is kind of expensive but I do want to come back to try their bulgogi and over korean fare!
author: Christine W.

description:
Normally, I'd simply walk by and ignore this hole-in-the-wall BBQ restaurant, tucked away on the corner of Polk and Clay. What drew me in is their bold sign that reads: "Unquestionably the best Korean BBQ in town."

That's like saying: "Hey Yelpers! Bring it on, bitches." To me, at least. So I gave it a try with my equally hungry buddy one day.

Let's just say it was not "unquestionably" the best KBBQ I've had, but it does hold up a fight.

The dinner combos are an amazing deal: Tempura, pot stickers, rice, vegetables, and a pile of meat. Yum! Their BBQs are over-done though, and the quality of the meat leaves much to be desired. Again, awesome for the price ($10 meal!).

What I don't seem to grasp though is the reason they charge an extra $0.50 for spicy meals. I've never seen such a thing before. And I don't want to see it ever again.
author: Nick A.

description: I've been searching for those short spare ribs forever and I found them here! I came back the next night for the exact same thing it was that good, and now I'm getting one to go....there's only one good place to get short ribs in Santa Rosa and sometimes they (Simply Vietnam on North Dutton Ave) run out so this is a great alternative.
author: Courtney V.

description:
I cannot understand why everyone loves this place. I have tried it at least 3 times and ordered something different every time to be fair. It's horrendous. First, let me say this is not Korean food. They give you meat that is just smothered in gravy. They could have gotten away with calling it Asian Fusion. You cannot taste the Korean flavors, nor does the gravy that they use to smother everything taste good. I've been disappointed every time and can't bother trying anymore at this point. I've even tried another location. Because so many people suggested it to me, I couldn't give up. But it's official, I'm throwing the towel in.

If you have never had Korean food you might like this. If you like Asian food smothered with crap to hide the actual Asian flavors, you'll love this place. Otherwise stay away. It's not worth the money, and if you love Korean you will NOT like this place!
author: Natasha S.

description:
I had always been a little wary of this place because of the sterile soulless look of the place. One night after a bunch of drinks a friend tells me it's really good and I decide to give it a try.

Let me tell you the servings here are huge!  I got the spicy pork and it was served on a massive plate jam packed full of meat, rice, and tempura veggies.  And only for 11 bucks!

This place was pretty damn tasty. I definitely recommend it.
author: Ryan J.

description: I am obsessed with this place and its sizzling bibimbop. I have been going here for years. Being in the food industry myself, I appreciate the consistency of the quality of food each and every time I go there. It is always fresh, hot and quick. What more could you want?
author: Alia P.

description:
Hands off.

Most BBQ chicken sandwiches are not for sharing. This one included.

Obscene amount of chicken packed inside a French roll. Subtle hint of BBQ sauce.

Simple concoction yet effective. Enjoyed every bite.

$7 and change felt about right.

Looking forward to sampling more at their other locations. Hands on as always.
author: Jason B.

description:
Fan.

They're obviously knwn for their hibachi, but they do a very solid tofu soup as well.

The people who work there are nice--even though they generally seem like they're harried which isn't the impression you're supposed to give your clientele.

They've got a great menu, and if you are solo and catch a seat by the window you get a chance to watch the very interesting group of people who comprise Polk street.
author: Paul C.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening. The place was quite empty, assuming most people were at home getting ready for their Friday night adventures. 

With a party of 4, we ordered chicken chap chae, chicken salad, kimchi beef tofu soup, and meat mountain. 

The chicken salad consisted of Korean BBQ chicken, sliced eggs, sliced tomatoes, and spinach greens. This dish is very fresh, bringing a crisp in every bite.   

The tofu soup was not mixed very well. All  the spices were settled in the very bottom making the top of the soup bland and the bottom of the soup too salty.
author: Sylvia C.

description:
I saw this place thanks to Muni route 19 and dragged a friend of mine here a few hours later to try it out. I originally had my mind set on getting some BBQ but was distracted when I saw a picture of tofu soup, my absolute go-to food for cold days and days when I can feel a cold coming on. I got the beef tofu soup ($10) in "medium" spice and my friend ordered bulgogi.

* Beef tofu soup: Terrible. I'm not Korean so I can't say whether this was more authentic than the ones I used to have in Atlanta. I just know that, comparatively, this tofu soup was super watery, barely flavored, lukewarm, not one bit spicy (usually medium would set my mouth on fire - just the way I like it), and had more tofu and zucchini than beef. The beef tofu soups in Atlanta are usually 50-50 in tofu and beef, a couple bucks cheaper, AND it comes bubbling hot with a raw egg you can crack into the soup yourself! The raw egg was definitely the best part. Anyway, my fault for ordering this on impulse.

* Bulgogi: Eh, slightly below average. There's not much meat and it comes with a ton of onions and glass noodles in it (as fillers I guess?). The sauce also had entirely too much sugar in it.

* Bi bim bop: I ordered this to-go after my disappointing tofu soup because I figured I should at least try the Yelper-recommended dish before I completely write off this restaurant in my book. I just had half of it for lunch and it was SOOO GOOOD! Despite being the smelliest to-go food my zipcar and my fridge have ever experienced, the rice and egg reheated nicely and, when stirred together with the rest of the cold veges and hot sauce, had my neighbors commenting on how delicious the hallway smelled a half hour later!

If I make a return trip, I'll be sticking with the bibimbop. It's $8.50 if you get it all cold and $10.50 if you get it "sizzling". Seems a bit much to charge for a heated version of the same dish but that's definitely the way to go if you're dining in.

Don't be adventurous like me and order something that isn't officially recommended on here. You'll regret it.
author: Amaryllia L.

description:
I was a little reserved about coming here but I NEEDED Korean food and I live 4 blocks away, so I caved in and came here last night. Totally unexpectedly surprised. The boyfriend loved the BBQ spicy pork. I hearted the BBQ Beef. We totally devoured the stuffed jalapenos which are deep fried tempura style. YUM.* The side of kimchee was perfecto  (I kinda wished they had all the cool pickles that most Korean joints have). The waitstaff was very attentive and friendly. Can't wait to go back and try out the bibimbop.

*They left the seeds in on one of the peppers and I seriously thought that I was going to cry. I like some spiciness but that little pepper kicked my ass. All the other peppers were mild, and delicious.
author: Natasha P.

description:
For what it is, a hole in the wall Korean place you'd probably never walk into just passing by, it was excellent. Sizzling bi bim bop with chicken was fresh and tasty - love the egg on top, and my friend had a combo platter with pork that was huge, literally brought on a serving platter. Pot stickers were superb; who doesn't like anything double deep fried. 

Affordable and filling, large beers, quick service ..what else could you want a few blocks from your house?
author: Natalie H.

description:
I love this place! I can't get enough of the sizzlin' bibimbap with beef... I've gotten it 3 times in the last two weeks. I'm seriously addicted.

I really like the atmosphere here. The place is big enough that they never have a wait to eat and it's never too loud. And the service is great. You'll never need to ask to get your water glass refilled. And the food comes out so quick! I always get two meals out of the bibimbap! 

I don't know why I only gave them 4 stars before... but after more than one dream about the bibimbap... I can safely say that I am hooked.

Bottom line: Best bibimbap!!!
author: Melissa H.

description:
I'll preface this by saying I lived in Korea for a year, so my standards are pretty high. There have been few, if any Korean restaurants in America that have come close to authentic. This is no different. It's good, but not perfect by any means.

However, you get a lot of bang for your buck here. For between 12-14 dollars, you can get a HUGE plate of meat. They have dishes literally called "pile 'o meat" and "meat mountain." I recommend the meat mountain. Their ribs are delicious, the meats aren't too saucy, and I was pleased overall. They give you a generous portion of beans and salad with a very tasty sauce, as well. 

While it's not Korea, for the price, it's hard to complain. The three of us left that restaurant with smiles on our faces, fully stuffed and satisfied. I've been a few times, and will return.
author: Nick B.

description:
I wish I could give half-stars because I feel like this place almost deserves a four star, but just doesn't quite make it in my mind.  The only entree i've ever gotten is the bibimbap hot pot and it definitely hits the spot when I need some comfort food.  It's kind of a go to dish for me when I'm not watching my diet on a cold rainy afternoon.

The Staff here has always been friendly and attentive when I've eaten in the restaurant.

I had some friends that lived in K-town in LA when I was in college and I definitely miss all the awesome Korean bbq down there.  This place almost brings back those memories.  If they were open late night, it would be a no-brainer 4 star for me.
author: Ted G.

description:
I've been coming to Hahn's for about 3 years now and I must say, the quality has been slowly going down hill. The food seems to just be getting a cheaper quality to it. for example, the meat is having much more fat to it and getting cut thinner and thinner. The combo plates are also getting less tempura and pot-stickers than they did before.
This is all happening while the prices seem to just keep going up.
I'll still eat here as its not terrible it's seriously not like it once was.
I also must say this one thing because I honestly can stand when a restaurant does this, they have now added a minimum to all their credit card charges and their most popular items (the combos) don't even reach the minimum.
I get it, you want people to buy more so you put a min on cards and you get charged for cards but when you own a business you also know that there are charges and fees, so Hahn's needs to get over it. Take the min off the cards and maybe I'll come by more often.
author: Cescilia A.

description:
Meh...i wasn't to impressed. 
The chicken was gristly and nasty.

The brown rice was was pretty good.

Service was just ok.  The food arrived super fast...my dates ribs looked like they had been sitting out forever..

Maybe it was just an off night..but i dont think i would rush back any time soon!
author: Ripley B.

description: Awful skimpy portions very little chicken or tofu in dish. Not recommend. Use to be great years ago.
author: T R Viewer E.

description: I ordered the chap chae here. I don't give very many two star ratings but my take out simply wasn't good. The noodles were incredibly salty and lack the sesame flavor that makes chap chea so tasty. It's basically bad mall food. Very disappointing :(.
author: Alice W.

description: It's great for what it is. Don't expect to be blown away, but if you are looking for cheap, large portions, this place is great for lunch!
author: Perry D.

description:
For anyone craving mounds and mounds of meat, well, this place is here for you. I got the pleasantly names Pile O' Beef while my friend had the Meat Mountain. Is was less mountainous than we thought it would be, but still quite tasty all around. The Bi Bim Bop was also quite delish and stayed quite hot for the duration of the meal (cast iron pot!).

Just found out there's one in my hood on Irving, so i'll be making my way there soon.
author: Phuong M.

description:
Love the Chicken BBQ. A great, filling, cheap meal with their delicious Stuffed Jalapenos!

Definitely a whole in the wall so dont go expecting a whole lot of ambiance!
author: David P.

description: I truly enjoyed the excellent service. Food was served promptly and very delicious! By the way the plate I had was enormous so well money worth! You should invite some friends and try it:-)
author: Jose P.

description:
So many great options on the menu that we both had a major challenge picking out our dish... the waiter was somewhat helpful in advising on this decision but mostly just responded, "well, that depends what you like..." I could have used a bit more help!

Luckily I loved my dish of chicken and veggie saute pan though. It was a great amount of food and enough for lunch left-overs. I ordered medium spiciness and the sauce was perfect. The grilled veggies were especially good and I loved the pickled sprout salad and green salad with miso dressing that also came on the plate. Jeff ordered the mega kabob combo and it was huge! Pork and veggies and chicken and shrimp and more plus the same sides as mine including a huge scoop of white rice. He shared some of the shrimp and chicken with me and I loved them! 

This restaurant is very casual but we did not have to wait for a table and the food came out fast. Parking was much more of a challenge though...
author: Meghan P.

description: I love this place. Get the BBQ chicken. The Tempura is perfect. One of the finest lunches under 15 bucks. YEA!!!!!!!
author: AL S.

description: I came here with my friends a few months ago and tried out their BBQ pork (which I asked for spicy) and stuffed jalapeno. The pork was good but it wasn't spicy at all. and for the stuffed jalapeno there was rarely any meat which got me a little disappointed. But the mood of the place is friendly and I enjoyed the awkward convos with my friends. I would come back again to try new items on the menu.
author: Miranda L.

description: I used to come to this Hahns Hibachi 13 years ago when it was just this one restaurant before it branched out. It's still good food. Not authentic Korean food but good tasting food and overall bang for the buck. My usual is the Chicken bbq and the mushroom appetizer. This always hits the spot. This Hahns location has expanded and is now bigger. It used to be only able to seat like 8 people. Im glad its still the same Hahns.
author: Dave C.

description:
Hahn's Hibachi = Korean Food Made Nasty!
  
I don't rat out restaurants, usually, but feel compelled to do just that in this case. Hahn's Hibachi on Polk Street is by far the most disgusting Korean restaurant I've ever been to. I've pretty much been to all of them in SF, e.g., Brother's, Han II Kwan, Muguboka, and even the one at Stonestown Mall and this one's got to be the most disgusting.  

When they brought me my food I thought I was at a school cafeteria!  Swear to God, that sh*t looked nasty, yo!  The BBQ pork was undercooked and didn't even look BBQed.  The chicken was mediocre at best -- it was swimming in a puddle of tasteless/flavorless terriyaki sauce.  How can an Asian restaurant fuck up their terriyaki sauce?  Isn't it just sugar, soy sauce, sesame oil?  You can buy that shit at Trader Joe's!  It was all watery and full of corn starch or glutinous clumps -- bland to say the least. 

The food wasn't accompanied by the customary Napa cabbage "kimchi." All Korean restaurants are well known for this preserved veg.  It a "must" to serve kimchi with Korean food.  I know that this is a dive and getting twenty little dishes of kimchi condiments would be an over stretched expectation...but come on, just don't forget the one that is a must!  

This place missed out on everything that was suppose to be Korean.  OMFG, the food was so nasty but I had just gone to the gym and was starving to death so you can imagine how bad it must have been for me to even say this.  Anyways, this place "was" my old hangout spot 10 years ago.  I frequented it so often back then that the cashier/owner knew exactly what I wanted to order.  But now, that has all changed for the worse and the conclusion I draw is that restaurants in the back drop of my memory lane is like old tossed out relationships, it is better to just not visit them, EVER...

I seriously don't understand how some people could rate this dump a 4 and 5 stars!  It's a total mystery to me!

Great Service! Very good food at good prices.

The main guy there who takes the orders -- is always fast, nice and efficient! He knows the menu and provides great service -- for both take out and eat-in at the restaurant.
Even the fun melon gum at the end is good.

We go there regularly.
author: John G.

description: I've been coming to Hahn's on and off for the past 5 years, or so. It's good, consistent, but not necessarily the best Korean out there. It's the only nearby Korean joint from where I live (or recently lived, rather), which makes it convenient for a quick and satisfying meat mountain plate, or perhaps some sizzling bibimbap. All in all a solid choice for A-OK Korean food.
author: Eric C.

description:
I used to go to Hahn's when I first lived in this neighborhood during another lifetime. For some reason, though I haven't moved far during years hence, I stopped going to Hahn's completely.

My favorite dish there was always the tofu veggie stir fry. Today I decided to stop in and try it. I told the kid waiting tables I hadn't been there in x years. He was very polite, but.... who cares?

The tofu stir fry tasted exactly the same! It has a nice smokey flavor and the veggies are seared but stil crisp. Very soulful and highly recommended.

Thank you Hahn's for staying the same! I'll be back soon.
author: Roxmarie M.

description: Very basic Korean food. I love Korean food, but this place is super basic and had little to no taste. I had to drown it in teriyaki sauce. I will not be returning, the two stars is for the woman working there she was super sweet.
author: Kv J.

description:
Don't get the bad grades I've seen on this page. The restaurant was really good for a normal price.
I ordered a Spicy Pork Bul Go Gi, I also tried what my friends ordered and I found back on my mouth all the great flavors of the Korean food!
The service was also good and friendly 
This place deserves a good review
author: John C.

description: I must agree with a previious review about the qulity here. I've been coming here for 12 years and the quality has gone downward. Its a good spot if I need to get a quick bite alone and read the paper without feeling awkward. Unfortunate that this place is not the awesome spot it used to be. Waiter dude is a little douchey, nothing crazy. Just kind of a strange douche air about him that will prevent me from coming back.
author: H K.

description:
Love this place for GOOD heaping amounts of Korean BBQ type meats over rice. I also LOVE the stuffed mushrooms here. They're a definite must order appetizer when I go there. Whether you order kalbi, chicken or another type of meat, it's certain to be good.
It's a small place, a few small tables outside, a small counter faces the window out to Polk St and several tables inside as well.
Service has always been good. I've been coming here for years. Try it, I'm sure you'll like it. No frills. Good, plentiful and mellow atmosphere. Wish I was back in The City to eat here.
author: Chuck D.

description:
Get the spicy beef or pork plates. Comes with plenty of rice and sprouts. Their pot stickers rock! Terribly hearty servings, split it with a friend if not hungry, or save some for later, or box it up and pass it on to one of the many beggars along Polk St. 

Super friendly staff, if an order was done wrong they've always been more than accommodating, sometime throwing in a free appetizer. Lots of seating and a fun view of Polk St. 

Very near several other eateries and drinkeries (bars), Bobs Donuts for dessert. Who knows. Maybe you're catching a show at one of the several venues along Polk. This is a great stop for a quick sit-down meal before a your night out, whatever that entails along Polk. Need to stay awake, hit up It's a Grind for some Java on the next corner up Polk.
author: Kelly S.

description: Above average food quality, clean environment, awesome hosts
author: Nan L.

description: BBQ pork sandwich was absolutely delicious.  Looking forward to going back soon!
author: Jules J.

description:
Love it! Hole in the wall great cheap goodness.

+ Service is fast & attentive
+ Cheap menu (lunch time)
+ Clean bathroom

I would come again!
author: Sarina I.

description: Best Koran BBQ I have ever tried! Never stop doing what you guys are doing! Anytime I'm in the city, I have to stop by and get my fix! For vegetarians try the tofu and veggies! It's awesome!
author: Sundep J.

description: Enjoyed my meal here. Laid back and friendly atmosphere. Excellent menu selection at affordable prices. The sizzling dishes are yummy!
author: Thea T.

description:
This is the first Hahn's Hibachi i ever went to.  On a warm and  sunny San Francisco day my pot dealer told me to come over to pick up so we could go get some weed.  I called him on my pink celly and asked him where he was.  He told me he is pigging out at his normal lunch spot that he loves so much.  I got there and he was pigging out on chicken.  I don't eat chicken, but it looked really good.  

So I ordered some vegetarian food for myself.  What I got was absolutely delicious.  I was really satisfied and glad that my stoner friend introduced me to this place.

We left in my car and my friend packed a bowl and we got really stoned.  Nice and full of Hahn's and nice and stoned.  One of the best days in my life.  After that we played video games and smoked some more.  It was a good day.  I love SF.

Since then I have been hooked on Hahn's Hibachi and I have gone to two other locations and had similar experiences.

I would give it 5 star but parking isn't that great and prices could be cheaper (no lunch specials).  I think it could be tastier also.  Maybe it can't be tastier and I just think it could be, who knows.

Thumbs up for Hahn's.
author: Cynthia B.

description: I'm a fan!  You dont smell like bbq bc they make it for you and the tofu soup thing was badass!
author: christopher h.

description: I'd like to say I don't eat here multiple times a week, but I just can't turn down that amazing and delicious lunch combo :)
author: Ryan W.

description:
Place is fine - nothing special, just moderately priced Korean as you would expect. I always get their Bibimbap and it is good. The waiters there are always attentive and prompt. 

Atmosphere is just a small, dinky restaurant. No frills but what you would expect.
author: Robert A.

description:
Excellent food, great service, good prices, and very fast!

Their bi bim bop is AMAZING (definitely get it in a clay pot).  Pork bul go gi is also very good.

If you're a fan of korean food, I strongly recommend this place.
author: Jason T.

description: I was craving some kind of meat and rice for lunch. At work we have a "Take Out Menu" binder in which we have take out menus from all sorts of restaurants. As I was flipping through I found the menu from Hanh's Hibachi. I've only had Korean once before. But figured I'd try the lunch special. The bbq beef lunch special came with rice, bbq beef, salad and shrimp tempura for about $8. The beef was soft and the sauce made it super yummy. Was perfect for the beef and rice craving and totally hit the spot. I can't believe I ate the entire thing at my desk. Stomach ache was fully deserved.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: I love Hahn's Hibachi! This is my new favorite place for meat free eatery. Since I've decided to change my diet to no meat .. I was thrilled to know they offered a Tofu Chop Chae! It is absolutely delicious! Try it! Try it! Go! Go! Go!
author: Kalok L.

description:
Good place for quick Korean BBQ.  I went there for lunch to-go, and got the $7.95 lunch special.  It's a rice plate with choice of meat, 2 shrimp tempuras, two potstickers or a chicken patty made with ground onions and garlic, and some bean sprout.   I ordered the spicy pork and it was a bit too sweet.  But it's a pretty big plate of food.  

Service was ok, asked us to sit while they're cooking the food.  It was quick, and metered parking is easy to find.
author: Tadaa T.

description: Nothing really stood out at this place. It was close, I was hungry, and the price was right. I wish I had used yelp before dining here, as I would have chosen a more reputable Chinese or Koren restaurant. I hear the Lime Tree is a better choice.
author: Nicole M.

description: Decent food. Good value. Kim chee is better than average and short ribs were well flavored.
author: Greg B.

description:
I came in for a late lunch and I could tell right away that this wasn't your typical Korean spot.  They didn't give any of us chopsticks.  And I'm Asian.  And it's a Korean BBQ restaurant.  Not the end of the world, but it made the place more intriguing in a good way.

It's not your typical grill your own meat setup.  There's no grill on your table at all, they handle the cooking for you -- makes sense, seeing as they are a restaurant and all ;)  I had the spicy BBQ chicken and it brought back so many memories of Gomnaru, one of my top go-to spots in Berkeley.  Very solid, plenty of meat.  I think its a great value.  They give you free kimchee if you ask.  I'll be back.
author: Vu N.

description: I went there with colleagues last Friday, the waiter told me they don't serve side dishes like other Korean restaurants, lunch special is kind of experience and not many choicese to choose from. Service was ok.
author: Nikki H.

description:
Sometimes you would think why you can't give everyone a 5 star?

TB brought me to the Hahn's Hibachi in my hood at Noe Valley last Christmas, I meant December, he likes doing this surprise stuff.

So yesterday, he did the same thing, while working somewhere down Polk street, he called and asked me to take the Cable Car and meet him there for lunch. I will never say NO...ever...first its my baby inviting...second its food...what more can I ask for?

So we went it, we were greeted which is always nice. We ordered, i love barbeque, be it filipino, memphis, southern, texan, korean....its that sweet - salty taste sometimes with a little bit of sourness. Again, Server keeps asking if everything is good, and since my baby wants to make sure that I got everything I need from a hot green tea that he wants me to take to finally cure my whooping cough to the ice cold soda that i usually crave when a hot good meal is serve.

TB finished his meal and I get to take some with me.

From the service to the food and the ambiance inside, I think everyone should try it, if they are in the hood.
author: Malou C.

description: Having mainly only eaten Korean food in Indiana, this place was amazing to me. I like it better than the other Hahn's in Noe Valley. The service is much nicer here. The owner and his wife are very warm and friendly. The seafood bib bom bop (sp?) with brown rice was delicious. My daughter thinks the other location gives more generous servings when it came to her seafood soup dish but it was lunch and I was satisfied.
author: Faina G.

description:
This is one of the few Korean places within walking distance of my place-- at least I think so.
