Low prices (for the area), and the food is usually ready within ten minutes if you call ahead.  Rarely eat here, but when I have the service is pretty good.  Would be 5 star if they delivered.
author: Eric L.

description: very good korean fast food. always delicious when im pressed for time. its not too expensive and the portions are generous. never had any real complaints about this location. like most others have already said though, this isnt the place you go to looking for spectacular authentic korean dining. this is more of a lunch break type place. but if thats all you're looking for i cant you having any problems here.
author: Andrew D.

description: Great food. Reasonable prices.  I never really eat in, always takeout, but the they are always pleasant and fast.  I'm not an expert enough to say whether this is authentic or not, but if you like tasty food and generous portions, this is a great place.
author: Joe D.

description: I live a block away, so I really wanted to like this place.  Unfortunately, the ribs were too dry and a little tough.  Missed the mark by a long shot.  I don't think I will give this place a second chance.
author: Luke P.

description: Finally decided to try this place because its around the corner from my apartment and I have walked by it so many times. Not the best Korean food ever but decent. I guess my favorite part about getting Korean bbq are the little dishes of kimchee and other savory goodness, which this place lacked bc its more of a take out place. The chicken bi bim bop was ok. It lacked flavor which I quickly remedied by adding copious amounts of the special chili sauce that came with the dish. The "mountain of meat" which was an assortment of kalbi, bbq chicken and other meats was very flavorful and awesome. The spicy tofu soup was also very yummy, but what cracked me up the most was that the menu described tofu as a "low-fat asian cheese." Having grown up eating tofu, I found this hilarious bc tofu is absolutely nothing like cheese. Oh well. I will prob return here sometime for take out when I can't make it to Korea House.
author: Lauren Y.

description: If you are looking for Americanized Korean food, this is not bad for the money.  I ate there once, their bibimbop is edible.    By the way, my husband got food poisoning from their BBQ beef.
author: Su Kyeong K.

description: Good casual Korean place.  The bibimbap was excellent, the portions large and the prices low.
author: C A.

description: Yummy food, great price. I love the BBQ chicken with rice and the potstickers. This is the best location of them all.
author: Rona m.

description: Tasty Korean food (although I can see how people say its Americanized).  What really bugged me though was that I had to order the kim chee as a side order?!  wtf?!  lame-o.  The portions are pretty huge, I ended up eating about 90% of my meal, which was more than likely about 40% more than I should have eaten.  I suppose it would depend on your appetite, or how much you normally eat, but next time I go here I'll try not to put myself in a food coma.  Very small dining area - I'd guess about 6 tables for 2 ppl, 1 for 4 ppl, and a bar for 4-5 looking out onto the street.  A bit cramped, decent service.
author: Margie N.

description: Finally! An asian restaurant that truly does NOT use msg in their food. I have a top notch msg detector and these people truly do not put a smidge in their food. And there is no need--there food is always fresh and tasty, and I don't have to suffer from a gut bomb after. This is my go to place when you have a last minute big group, the staff is so accomodating and pleasant, service excellent, and great yummy clean food.
author: Linda Y.

description: I must have been here 20 times and have never ordered anything but the sizzling bi bim bop. WOW
author: erik l.

description: Good, relatively cheap eats...hearty portions. I ordered the bi bim bop which had a nice flavor, but wasn't as piping hot as my friend's order or pork bulgogi (which was also flavorful & spicy). Next time I will order the bi bim bop in the sizzling platter. Small restaurant, so good for small groups (1-4 people). Fast service, clean. Nice neighborhood joint that I need to frequent more & add to my restaurant rotation!
author: D L.

description: I go here regularly for a quick dinner on my way home, and it's basic decent food- nothing fancy, but I haven't had anything horrible either.
author: Eric S.

description:
wow.  goddamn that that spicy bbq chix is on point!  i sense the slightest bit of siracha but it blends well and does not come across as relient on "spice". i can comment on the bbq spare ribs but would not recommend based on all around deliciousness and that incredible bbq sauce vs chix.  really, go to HH for the bbq chix (mmmm...dark meat), the side salad with sticky sauce but skip the sprout salad.  feels like you are eatin' fish bait and sesame oil. 
servers are cool too........
author: Karl H.

description: We called for order togo on last Wednesday. The lady who pick up the phone call seem dont understand English very well. Well well and well we tried to not mention about it but it was annoy. Food was good we got the short ribs they came with 3 giant big ass bones. It's so good. highly recommend this place.
author: Grace C.

description: Great Korean BBQ of all type. The chicken is their defining dish and you can't find a healthier, tastier, less costly meal in the entire city: lean grilled chicken, rice, and kim-chee. The beef ribs are also great. Family service with a smile and tasty watermelon chewing gum for free. A staple, I've been going for years and never leave disappointed or hungry. Love Hahn's!
author: Alessandra I.

description: my friends get mad when i call this korean food, but for a quick bite with great taste this is the place for a bit of korean flavor.  the bbq is fantastic and the sampler plate is great.  thier meat mountain order is not as big as it used to be, but still resonably priced.  I like the fact that they added a little humor to thier menu as well, gives the place a little character.
author: eddo l.
